description.para: Settings applied to the global ParticleManager

sectiondef.header: API for compatibility with Particle/ParticleSource create/play

description.para: Mimics the static Create and Play methods from Particle/ParticleSource

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, vector pos, bool playOnCreation=false, Object parent=null, vector ori=vector.Zero, bool forceWorldRotation=false, Class owner=null)
memberdef.name: CreateParticle

briefdescription.para: Create function.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList
vector Position of ParticleSource in LS (WS when no parent)
bool Whether to play immediately after creation (Optional)
Object Parent Object which will child the ParticleSource (Optional)
vector Orientation of ParticleSource in LS (WS when no parent) (Pitch, Yaw, Roll in degrees) (Optional)
bool Forces orientation to rotate relative to the world and not with the parent (Optional)
Class The owning instance for this particle (Optional)

simplesect.para: ParticleSource Created particle instance when successful

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, vector pos, int flags=ParticlePropertiesFlags.NONE, Object parent=null, vector ori=vector.Zero, Class owner=null)
memberdef.name: CreateParticleEx

briefdescription.para: Master create function.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList
vector Position of ParticleSource in LS (WS when no parent)
int See ParticlePropertiesFlags (Optional)
Object Parent Object which will child the ParticleSource (Optional)
vector Orientation of ParticleSource in LS (WS when no parent) (Pitch, Yaw, Roll in degrees) (Optional)
Class The owning instance for this particle (Optional)

simplesect.para: ParticleSource Created particle instance when successful

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, Object parent_obj, vector local_pos="0 0 0", vector local_ori="0 0 0", bool force_world_rotation=false)
memberdef.name: CreateOnObject

briefdescription.para: Creates a particle emitter and attaches it on the given object.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList
Object Instance on which this particle will be attached
vector Attachment position local to the parent (Optional)
vector Orientation local to the parent (Pitch, Yaw, Roll in degrees) (Optional)
bool Forces particle's orientation to rotate relative to the world and not with the object (Optional)

simplesect.para: ParticleSource Created particle instance

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, Object parent_obj, vector local_pos="0 0 0", vector local_ori="0 0 0")
memberdef.name: Create

briefdescription.para: Legacy function for backwards compatibility.

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, vector global_pos, vector global_ori="0 0 0", bool force_world_rotation=false)
memberdef.name: CreateInWorld

briefdescription.para: Creates a particle emitter on the given position.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList
Vector Position where the particel will be created
vector Orientation (Pitch, Yawn, Roll in degrees) (Optional)
bool Has absolutely no effect here as there is no parent

simplesect.para: ParticleSource Created particle instance

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, vector global_pos, vector global_ori="0 0 0")
memberdef.name: Create

briefdescription.para: Legacy function for backwards compatibility with 1.01 and below.

description.para: You can use the following Play(...) functions to create and activate a particle in 1 line of your script.

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, Object parent_obj, vector local_pos="0 0 0", vector local_ori="0 0 0", bool force_world_rotation=false)
memberdef.name: PlayOnObject

briefdescription.para: Creates a particle emitter, attaches it on the given object and activates it.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList
Object Instance on which this particle will be attached
vector Attachment position local to the parent (Optional)
vector Orientation local to the parent (Pitch, Yaw, Roll in degrees) (Optional)
bool Forces particle's orientation to rotate relative to the world and not with the object (Optional)

simplesect.para: ParticleSource Created particle instance

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, Object parent_obj, vector local_pos="0 0 0", vector local_ori="0 0 0")
memberdef.name: Play

briefdescription.para: Legacy function for backwards compatibility with 1.01 and below.

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, vector global_pos)
memberdef.name: PlayInWorld

briefdescription.para: Creates a particle emitter on the given position and activates it.

parameterdescription.para: int Particle ID registered in ParticleList
Vector Position where the particel will be created

simplesect.para: ParticleSource Created particle instance

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, Object parent_obj, vector global_pos, vector global_ori="0 0 0", bool force_world_rotation=false)
memberdef.name: PlayInWorldEx

memberdef.argsstring: (int particle_id, vector global_pos)
memberdef.name: Play

briefdescription.para: Legacy function for backwards compatibility with 1.01 and below.

description.para: API for creating, playing or obtaining particles from the pool

memberdef.argsstring: (array< ParticleSource > particles, string path, notnull ParticlePropertiesArray properties, int count=1)
memberdef.name: CreateParticles

briefdescription.para: Creates an amount of particles with the properties given.

parameterdescription.para: array<ParticleSource> The resulting particles if an array is given
string Path of particle effect
ParticleProperties Properties of the particles created
int Amount of particles to create with these properties

simplesect.para: int Amount of particles created in this frame, if the ParticleManager is still allocating while this is called and virtual particles are enabled, the overflow particles will be virtual instead and not given in the out array

memberdef.argsstring: (string path, notnull ParticleProperties properties)
memberdef.name: CreateParticleByPath

briefdescription.para: Create a particle.

parameterdescription.para: string Path of particle effect
ParticleProperties Properties of the particles created

simplesect.para: ParticleSource The resulting particle

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, notnull ParticlePropertiesArray properties, int count)
memberdef.name: CreateParticlesById

briefdescription.para: QoL function using script ParticleList, strongly recommend to read comments for CreateParticles as well.

parameterdescription.para: int ID of particle registered in ParticleList
ParticleProperties Properties of the particles created
int Amount of particles to create with these properties

simplesect.para: int Amount of particles created in this frame, if the ParticleManager is still allocating while this is called and virtual particles are enabled, the overflow particles will be virtual instead

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, notnull ParticlePropertiesArray properties, int count)
memberdef.name: CreateParticlesByIdArr

briefdescription.para: QoL function using script ParticleList, strongly recommend to read comments for CreateParticles as well.

parameterdescription.para: int ID of particle registered in ParticleList
ParticleProperties Properties of the particles created
int Amount of particles to create with these properties

simplesect.para: array<ParticleSource> The resulting particles - Read particles param of CreateParticles

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, ParticleProperties properties)
memberdef.name: CreateParticleById

briefdescription.para: QoL function for when only one particle is needed using script ParticleList, strongly recommend to read comments for CreateParticles as well.

parameterdescription.para: int ID of particle registered in ParticleList
ParticleProperties Properties of the particles created

simplesect.para: ParticleSource The resulting particle

memberdef.argsstring: (out array< ParticleSource > particles, string path, notnull array< vector > positions, int count=1)
memberdef.name: PlayParticles

briefdescription.para: QoL function for when wanting to play a particle at a position right away.

parameterdescription.para: array<ParticleSource> The resulting particles if an array is given
string Path of particle effect
array<vector> Positions of particles
int Amount of particles to create at this position

simplesect.para: int Amount of particles created in this frame, if the ParticleManager is still allocating while this is called and virtual particles are enabled, the overflow particles will be virtual instead and not given in the out array

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, array< vector > positions, int count)
memberdef.name: PlayParticlesById

briefdescription.para: QoL function using script ParticleList, strongly recommend to read comments for PlayParticles as well.

parameterdescription.para: int ID of particle registered in ParticleList
array<vector> Positions of particles
int Amount of particles to create at this position

simplesect.para: array<ParticleSource> The resulting particles - Read particles param of PlayParticles

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, array< vector > position)
memberdef.name: PlayParticleById

briefdescription.para: QoL function for when only one particle is needed using script ParticleList, strongly recommend to read comments for PlayParticles as well.

parameterdescription.para: int ID of particle registered in ParticleList
array<vector> Positions of particles

simplesect.para: ParticleSource The resulting particle

memberdef.argsstring: (int index)
memberdef.name: GetParticle

briefdescription.para: Manually get the particle at index.

parameterdescription.para: int Index of particle

simplesect.para: ParticleSource ParticleSource at given index

memberdef.argsstring: (out array< ParticleSource > outArray, int startIndex, int count)
memberdef.name: GetParticles

briefdescription.para: Manually get a portion of the particles in the pool.

parameterdescription.para: array<ParticleSource> The resulting particles
int Starting index
int Amount of particles to get

simplesect.para: int Amount of particles in outArray

memberdef.argsstring: (int startIndex, int count)
memberdef.name: GetParticlesEx

briefdescription.para: Manually get a portion of the particles in the pool.

parameterdescription.para: int Starting index
int Amount of particles to get

simplesect.para: array<ParticleSource> The resulting particles

memberdef.argsstring: (string name)
memberdef.name: SetName

briefdescription.para: Set a name for the ParticleManager to identify it more easily.

parameterdescription.para: string Name for ParticleManager

briefdescription.para: Gets the debug name for the ParticleManager.

parameterdescription.para: string "name:id"

briefdescription.para: Gets the debug name for the ParticleManager.

simplesect.para: string "name:id"

briefdescription.para: Gets the ID for the ParticleManager.

simplesect.para: int ID for the ParticleManager (different every restart, as it is the nth instance created since the start of the program)

briefdescription.para: Gets the amount of ParticleManager that have been created since the start of the program.

simplesect.para: int Amount of ParticleManager that have been created since the start of the program

briefdescription.para: Gets the amount of ParticleManager that are currently existing.

simplesect.para: int Amount of ParticleManager that are currently existing

description.para: Obtain information about the state of the ParticleManager

briefdescription.para: Gets the fixed maximum size of the pool.

simplesect.para: int The fixed maximum size of the pool

briefdescription.para: Gets the amount of particles currently allocated.

simplesect.para: int Amount of particles currently allocated

briefdescription.para: Gets the amount of virtual particles.

simplesect.para: int Amount of virtual particles currently waiting to be turned into real particles

briefdescription.para: Gets the amount of playing particles.

simplesect.para: int Amount of currently playing particles

briefdescription.para: Checks if the ParticleManager has allocated all slots in the pool.

simplesect.para: bool True when the number of allocated particles is the same as the pool size

memberdef.argsstring: (Managed events)
memberdef.name: SetScriptEvents

briefdescription.para: Set the events.

parameterdescription.para: Managed The events to set

briefdescription.para: Get the events.

simplesect.para: Managed If there is any events set, this will return them

briefdescription.para: Get the events.

simplesect.para: ParticleManagerEvents If there is any events set, this will return them so that additional functionality can be bound to them

memberdef.argsstring: (array< ParticleSource > allocatedParticles)
memberdef.name: OnAllocation

briefdescription.para: Particles will be locked to the index and not reused.
Allocation blocks the game until it is done.
Disable the creation of virtual particles when the pool is still allocating.
Reuse stopped particles even if they are owned by something.
Flags for ParticleManagerSettings.
Has a fixed pool of precreated and reserved particles.

memberdef.argsstring: (int poolSize, int flags=ParticleManagerSettingsFlags.NONE)
memberdef.name: ParticleManagerSettings

briefdescription.para: Settings given to ParticleManager on creation (in ctor)

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor (ctor)
poolSize
int Size of pool (amount of created and reserved particles)
flags
int ParticleManagerSettingsFlags

briefdescription.para: dtor
Access to the static ParticleManager.
To clean it up properly before game closes.

memberdef.argsstring: (ParticleManagerSettings settings)
memberdef.name: ParticleManager

briefdescription.para: Constructor (ctor)

parameterdescription.para: ParticleManagerSettings Settings for the ParticleManager

briefdescription.para: dtor
